In light of recent discussions about Tuvalu in the China-Taiwan issue, consider the following statements:
  1. Tuvalu is in the South China Sea.
  2. It is a part of Oceania.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Tuvalu is an island nation located in the Pacific Ocean. It is located between Australia and Hawaii. It is one of the last few remaining allies of Taiwan in its stand against Chinese takeover. Tuvalu along with Nauru, Marshall Islands and Palau recognise Taiwanâ€™s sovereignty. Statement 2 is correct: Tuvalu islands are a part of Oceania. It is inhabited mainly by Polynesians. A minority of Micronesians are also part of its population. Oceania stretches across both eastern and western hemispheres. It is located in the neighbourhood of Kiribati, Solomon Islands, Fiji and Samoa.
